Name: Divine Boat Carried by God Sobek
Description: The divine boat is the same as the boats that sailed on the Nile in Ancient Egypt; however, the difference between common boats and divine ones was the cargo and crew. This boat is carrying a naos or shrine decorated with a frieze of cobras and topped by a statuette of the god Horus. Horus is depicted wearing the Double Crown of Upper and Lower Egypt on his head. The ship has two large oars at the stern and many deities form the crew. The boat is carried by the crocodile god, Sobek, who is standing on the top of a column with a papyriform, or papyrus-like, capital.
